extendedInfo.description: Mike Singleton's '84 classic Adventure Strategy game, brought to and updated for Android. "The Lords of Midnight is not simply an adventure game nor simply a war game. It was really a new type that became known as an epic game, for as you play the Lords of Midnight you will be writing a new chapter in the history of the peoples of the Free. You will guide individual characters across the land of Midnight on vital quests but you will also command armies that must endeavour to hold back the foul hordes of Doomdark, the witch king. Yours will be no inevitable victory." - Mike Singleton 1984 I've tried to make this compatible with as many Android devices as possible without actually owning them all. Hopefully we won't have too many hiccups along the way! If you have any issues please please contact me through www.thelordsofmidnight.com/support so that I can work with you to resolve them.Reviews for the iOS version===================="Lords of Midnight does story-based, large-scope, high-fantasy warfare better than most titles I can think of, iOS or otherwise." - Rating 4/5- PocketTactics.com "This is an outstanding remake and developer Chris Wild, should feel very proud of creating such a superb celebration of the manâs work." - Rating 8/10 - Metro "#1 - Top 5 iPhone and iPad games of the week" - AppMyWorld.com "If you're interested in classic games, especially fantasy and/or strategy games, Lords of Midnight is a must-have." - Rating 4/5 - TouchArcade.com "App of the Year!" - Rating 5/5, Mirror.co.uk "It's an unmissable remake. Few titles weather the storms of time as well as this solid-gold classic." - Rating 4/5 - PocketGamer.co.uk "A must own title; pure genius and extremely entertaining. Recommended." - Rating 98/100 - Arcade Life âMade of extremely bright colors and clean lines, a stylistic choice that was and still is very original.â â Multiplayer.it "Despite the perfectly adapted touch controls and crisp graphic presentation, this is a proper 1980s they-donât-make-âem-like-they-used-to game" - PocketTactics.com "#3 - Top 10 iPad games and apps of December 2012" - QualityIndex.com "If you love a game, love the gameâs creator and want to produce an updated tribute â hereâs your benchmark. Almost thirty years old and yet it feels fresh, relevant and completely at home on a touch screen. Recommended without reservation â so good it makes me want to cry." - Arcade Life "Original, longed for and a perfect adaptation of a legendary game. Unlike those Spectrum conversions that are strictly for nostalgia lovers, Chris Wildâs Lords of Midnight will enthrall any gamer who thinks he has what it takes for a true battle of wits where only the most brilliant commanders will survive." - Louise Mensch, Mirror.co.uk "Lords of Midnight is an experience that everybody with a remote interest in games should have, buying into your characters and developing your own war stories is a wonderful thing. reviews.title: Masterpiece
reviews.comment: This game is to strategy gaming what Tolkien\'s work is to high fantasy literature: an epic, genre-defining masterpiece.  The interface is simple and intuitive.  The stylish graphics look great, while retaining the iconic look of the original. The new features - especially the map and lord grouping - are welcome additions to the original game. Any fan of strategy games simply must buy this game.
reviews.author: Dan Pyke

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Just like you said it took me to a time in my youth. Very sorry to hear of Mike\'s passing, this prob one of the first games to grab me, along with laser squad and x-com. Easy going game to play. Would hope some other classics could be as smoothly running on today\'s equipment. Remember also meglo-mania.lol
reviews.author: Jason Boyce

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Very good remake of one of my favourite games of all time. Happy to replace the unofficial port with this one. Can\'t wait for Doomdark Revenge. New Graphics are awesome but wish there was an option to toggle between them and the original speccy ones.
reviews.author: Ed Stevens

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: This was the best game of its time when I got my first Spectrum.  It is a perfect replica and brings back some amazing memories.  The story is superb and the pace perfect.  If you\'ve not played this game before but are prepared to be totally immersed in an epic tale then you have a real treat ahead.
reviews.author: Jeremy Burrows

reviews.title: Superb
reviews.comment: Rest easy Mike, they did an awesome job. One very minor feature id like to see is the ability to select lords off of the map in the case where multiple lords occupy the same location but I\'m just being lazy. Good work.
reviews.author: Clive Sharpe

reviews.title: Ok.
reviews.comment: I don\'t see why everyone thinks this game is amazing. The developer has done a good job but in my opinion the game is boring. I think this is possibly because the game was around before I was born so a lot of people are enjoying the game as a novelty. Whereas because I\'ve never knew the game previously, I find it extremely boring.  Good point: Developer has done a great job.  Bad point: Boring game.
reviews.author: Matthew Ferguson

reviews.title: Reminiscing of the good old days!
reviews.comment: You youngsters won\'t understand the impact this game had on the gaming industry, it was magnificent,  glad to rediscover my youth! Just spent the last hour playing and I must say they\'ve done a fantastic job it plays great! I\'m sure Mike Singleton would be proud that we\'re still playing his game 30 years on. Hopefully we\'ll get more classic game conversions to Android as Android is the future!
reviews.author: Carl Skusa

reviews.title: Just one more turn.......
reviews.comment: So glad I pushed the button on this, especially as it cost me less than the original! I am always wary of  \"tributes\", \"re workings\" etc, as generally they end up pants, and I am left with a slightly soiled feeling. This one has given me a blast of anti cynicism worthy of the term epiphany. Glorious graphics, touch screen loveliness and enough refining of the interface to truly feel like it is a build and enhancement of the original. I still get the same \"oh no\" moment when I see strange flags unexpectedly, and my old tried and tested techniques don\'t work as well as I remember! And I no longer need a pencil and map! Huzzah - as the days of me bothering with that are long gone. Also impressive is the developer\'s response to feedback and suggestions. I have waited a while before reviewing to judge this and its pleasing to see the way this is handled. A real labour of love, and the carefully crafted hand of a true fan is obvious throughout. Thank you - now where was that vengeful daughter again?
reviews.author: Maj Defect

reviews.title: Best \302\2432.99 I spent in ages!!
reviews.comment: Loved this in my youth, now I can play it properly as its near impossible on an emu without the keyboard overlay. Just amazing thanks
reviews.author: Kay Jay

reviews.title: Great but
reviews.comment: Rather than focusing on trying to make ddr, you could make this great with different scenarios and challenges. Otherwise it is just a copy of a game that was great in its time...
reviews.author: David Scrivens

reviews.title: Classic game from a great guy
reviews.comment: RIP MIke. Thanks for making winter evenings fly by in the 80\'s exploring the land of midnight. Modern games developers should take a look to see how it is done!
reviews.author: Sean Flannigan

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.comment: Just perfect.. The game in many ways has just not aged.
reviews.author: stephen brazier

reviews.title: Neat game
reviews.comment: Cool open-world game.__One small thing that I think would be a great help would be maybe a \"choose\" icon on the think/seek/hide screen (smaller icons?). As it is now, it takes three taps to go from thinking to seeking. Also, maybe provide a way to disable the direction arrows that flicker when scrolling or tapping a direction (or just scrap them)? They don\'t add anything and seem a little annoying after playing awhile.__In any case, this game is worth trying.
reviews.author: Paul Eastland

reviews.title: Still Amazing
reviews.comment: My all time favourite game brought up to date. Chris Wild has done wonders with the series over the years (DOS port, Midnight Engine) and this is the crowning glory.   Mike would have been proud, but of course you know that already :)
reviews.author: Larnen McCarron

reviews.title: Classic Stuff
reviews.comment: An update to a genuine all-time classic that everybody should play.  This is computer gaming history at it\'s best.  Roll on Doomdark\'s Revenge!!
reviews.author: Paul Houston

reviews.title: better than the original
reviews.comment: For those who remember the old one, you won\'t be disappointed. A perfect update in that it plays just like the old game while looking more polished and having a few new features that don\'t actually impact in the authenticity.
reviews.author: james markun

reviews.title: A classic brought back
reviews.comment: Loved this game way back in the spectrum days. The gameplay is smooth and fast. The graphics are superb and kept in the traditional way. Thank you for bringing back this legendary game.
reviews.author: Colin Buick

reviews.title: Legendary Game
reviews.comment: Back to when I was 13 yay!
reviews.author: Michael Thomas

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.comment: Updated version of best C64 game ever.  RIP Mike.
reviews.author: David Brundall

reviews.title: Love this game
reviews.comment: Played it the first time around, it\'s just as much fun this time around also.
reviews.author: Bunny Brown
